definitions.definition: Belief in a spiritual or metaphysical reality (often including at least one deity), accompanied by practices or rituals pertaining to the belief.
definitions.example: My brother tends to value religion, but my sister not as much.

definitions.definition: A particular system of such belief, and the rituals and practices proper to it.
definitions.example: Eckankar is a new religion but Zoroastrianism is an old religion.

definitions.definition: The way of life committed to by monks and nuns.
definitions.example: The monk entered religion when he was 20 years of age.

definitions.definition: Rituals and actions associated with religious beliefs, but considered apart from them.
definitions.example: I think some Christians would love Jesus more if they weren't so stuck in religion.

definitions.definition: Any practice to which someone or some group is seriously devoted.
definitions.example: At this point, Star Trek has really become a religion.

definitions.definition: Faithfulness to a given principle; conscientiousness.
To make sacred or symbolic; sanctify.
